title: 109_s3583
content: REGULATION OF PAYROLL TAX DEPOSIT AGENTS: An amendment to Chapter 77 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 adds a new section regarding payroll tax deposit agents. The Secretary will establish a system for registration and renewal of payroll tax deposit agents, including fees, bonding or audits options, required disclosures, and direct notification to employers by tax authorities. The curr_chunk discusses penalties for unregistered payroll tax deposit agents who fail to make employment tax deposits, with fines up to $10,000 for noncompliance every 90 days. It defines a payroll tax deposit agent as a person providing payroll processing services with authority to access an employer's funds for tax deposits. The curr_chunk explains that for the purposes of the section, employment tax includes unemployment insurance contributions. It also details the requirements for bonding and annual audits for payroll tax deposit agents. Bond amounts range from $50,000 to $500,000, and audits must be conducted by an independent third party based on specified principles. The curr_chunk discusses the requirements for payroll tax deposit agents, including the need for escrow accounts, non-commingling of funds, evidence of tax payments, and disclosure requirements to clients. The curr_chunk outlines the requirements for payroll tax deposit agents, including providing necessary information to clients, restrictions on who can make tax deposits and file returns, and the Secretary's authority to prescribe regulations. Additionally, payroll tax deposit agents are subject to penalties for failure to collect and pay over tax. The Code of 1986 is amended to include payroll tax deposit agents. This amendment does not affect the interpretation of section 6672 of the Internal Revenue Code. Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for chapter 77. The Code of 1986 is amended to include payroll tax deposit agents, with effective dates specified for the amendments.
